Description: Terracotta female figure. Naked pregnant woman, squatting with legs raised on each side to expose her genitals. Her left hand is on her left leg, the bottom of her left leg is lost; she indicates her pubic area with her right hand. She looks down to her right; her hair has a centre parting. Hollow and from a two-piece mould, with thick traces of a white dressing. Micaceous brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Ireland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A number of similar nude female birth figures have been found at Naukratis (Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA496, NA516) or are attributed to Naukratis (British Museum GR1973,0501.55; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum E.104.1914; Ashton et al. 2004: no. 92). Ptolemaic parallels (Montserrat 1996, pl. 23; Dunand 1990, no. 562; Grmek and Gourevitch 1998, 167, fig. 115), from Memphis (Petrie Museum UC33447) and Akoris (Tsujimura 1999, 16, fig. 12:6). Hellenistic parallel from Cyrenaica, regarded as based upon Egyptian examples (Burn and Higgins 2001, no. 2777). Ashton, S.-A., Buttrey, T. and Popescu, A. 2004. Roman Egyptomania, London. Burn, L., Higgins, R., Catalogue of Greek Terracottas in the British Museum, III, London. Dunand, F. 1990, Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte, Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.476) (Phase 3)
